text: [Music]
hey guys it's angel I love herbal
chicken soups so today I'm going to show
you my grandma's ginkgo nut and lotus
root chicken soup now the great thing
about this soup is the special
ingredients in ginkgo nuts now if you
aren't familiar with ginkgo nuts and
mandarin we call these by pol and
they're known in Oriental cooking
because of its medicine eval use now
grandma calls this theme memory soup
because they're supposed to help with
cognitive function and improving and
helping your memory so good for people
like me who are super forgetful but if
you haven't cooked with these before I
just wanted to let you know that ginkgo
nuts need to be cooked all the way
through so you don't want to eat them
raw because they're not good for you and
also some people are sensitive to ginkgo
nuts so you want to make sure that
you're aware of that and don't consume
too many all at once so with that let's
get started with the ingredients for
this recipe we'll need about 6 to 8
chicken drumettes that's about a pound
and a half now you could also use a
whole chicken here but I've gone ahead
to use chicken drumettes because they're
smaller and easier to put and separate
into small bowls you'll also need a
small piece of lotus root which looks
like this and finally we'll need about 1
cup of gingko nuts now these are shelled
gingko nuts and we'll want to remove the
shells and if you don't want to do that
you can actually buy them unshelled and
prepared like I have here now it's
easier to buy them unshelled so I'm
gonna go ahead and use my unshelled 1
but will again will need about a cup and
a half of these first start by blanching
the chicken in a pot of boiling water
blanch that for about a minute discard
the water and save that chicken then
bring another fresh pot of water to a
boil next add the chicken gingko nuts
and lotus root cover that with the lid
and let that simmer for 25 to 30 minutes
then uncover and let that cook for
another 50
minutes for a total cooking time of 45
minutes when it's done cooking serve in
small serving bowls hot you can add a
little bit of salt to taste maybe add a
little bit of garnish of cilantro or
green onions so that's how you make my
grandma's ginkgo and lotus root chicken
soup the kitchen smells amazing it
smells so good right now and since I
didn't have lunch I am going to do the
taste test a little pink oh not here mmm
they love half of the ginkgo nut is a
little bit chewy and it's got a little
bit of bitter taste it's really good mmm
soups amazing especially if you like
chicken soup you guys should definitely
try this thank you guys so much for
watching if you guys want to see an
herbal tea recipe next give me a thumbs
up for that and I will see you guys soon
bye for now
[Music]
